channel.title: Apple/Android Games
channel.description:
Hey everyone, so I have recently decided I want to make a game for the Apple and Android store but I have no knowledge of how to do so. I was hoping that somebody could lead me the right direction and help me start out by helping me find the programs I need, a video/written tutorial. At the moment, I just want help starting the actual programming of the game, and I can figure out how to get it onto the app and play store myself (hopefully :|) So if anybody could help start me out with the programming aspect of this whole thing, I would appreciate it a lot.
Thanks!!

item.title: Apple/Android Games
item.dc:creator: @JavaX JavaX
item.description:
@JavaX wrote:

I found it a lot easier to just use an IDE like eclipse with the Android SDK plugin(?).
I think a lot of the other tools and programs just over complicate things. With eclipse and the Android SDK you can create a blank “activity” and it also has a few good examples built in also. Just google searching how to setup and install eclipse with Android SDK will give you a wealth of links.

After you have all that setup, it’s just a matter of getting used to the way Android handles things.

As mentioned before for iOS; I believe you can start creating games for the iOS platform, but as for testing/debugging and actually compiling the code, you need to be running a MAC OS.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple/Android Games
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

You might want to look into Xamarin for Android development. I’ve always had good experiences with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Apple/Android Games
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:4, topic:534097”]not necessarily. you will need a mac to compile the code for ios.

[quote author=Vain_ link=topic=625948.msg4364297#msg4364297 date=1379355156]
if you are referring to ‘app’ as in mobile app development:

ios
if you have a mac, or install a virtual machine on your computer, you can download xCode

if you don’t have a mac, and refuse to install a virtual machine:

jQueryMobile -> PhoneGap
^ simple method seeing as you’re only going to be using a website, and not much more.

you can look into nomad, marmalade, or corona.

you can also use winchain

you can also look into services like xcodeclub and macincloud

for android/kindle/nook/blackberry:
just download the sdk

if you were referring to ‘app’ as in application, for computers.
you can use javafx

http://docs.oracle.com/javafx/2/webview/jfxpub-webview.htm
[/quote][/quote]

Thank you so much Vain! This really helps a LOT. I would have no idea even where to start. Thanks bro!

Read full topic

item.title: Apple/Android Games
item.dc:creator: @b00mz1029 b00mz1029
item.description:
@b00mz1029 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:2, topic:534097”]http://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html
http://developer.android.com/guide/components/index.html

https://developer.apple.com/devcenter/ios/index.action
https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/navigation/#section=Resource%20Types&topic=Sample%20Code

also, you need a mac for ios development, or you will have to have some type of wrapper.

also, there are other apis for game development on the apps, that are native to both platforms.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12234457/2d-cross-platform-game-engine-for-android-and-ios

depending on your language experience, you may have different results.[/quote]

So with
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12234457/2d-cross-platform-game-engine-for-android-and-ios
I will be able to create ios and android apps using windows?

Read full topic

item.title: Apple/Android Games
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

http://developer.android.com/sdk/index.html
http://developer.android.com/guide/components/index.html

https://developer.apple.com/devcenter/ios/index.action
https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/navigation/#section=Resource%20Types&topic=Sample%20Code

also, you need a mac for ios development, or you will have to have some type of wrapper.

also, there are other apis for game development on the apps, that are native to both platforms.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12234457/2d-cross-platform-game-engine-for-android-and-ios

depending on your language experience, you may have different results.

Read full topic
